info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BEAUFORT AND COLLETON COUNTIES... At 418 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Dale, or 8 miles north of Beaufort, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to nickel sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Beaufort, Dale, Gardens Corner and White Hall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
